pageContext.claim: “Yeah, let's take 100 percent of your wealth away. No, no. Even if you don't like me; some of you don’t. Some of you I don't like at all, actually. And you're going to be my biggest supporters because you'll be out of business in about 15 minutes, if [Warren wins].”
pageContext.analysis: Sen. Elizabeth Warren's wealth tax would not take away 100 percent of a person's wealth. Warren's "Ultra-Millionaire Tax" would apply to households with a net worth of $50 million or more, essentially the wealthiest 75,000 households. They would be charged 2 percent of every dollar of net worth above $50 million - unless they were billionaires. Households with $1 billion or more in assets would start paying 3 percent on assets above $1 billion.
